title.narrative: Technical Assistance for Revenue Policy and Administration

description.narrative: Build internal, managerial, and system controls to detect and deter corruption in the audit, collection and deposit processes. Implement a focused program to systematically investigate and respond to employee corruption and misconduct. Assist in drafting tax-related legislation that will combine international best practices with local requirements. Support change management initiatives so that the vision of management is translated into reform-minded action.

activity-date.narrative: Date unavailable. Calculated start date is the earliest transaction date
Date unavailable. Calculated end date is the latest transaction date

person-name.narrative: Andrew Velthaus, Jennifer Lee, and Kelley Vito

title.narrative: Technical Assistance for Liberia - Revenue Policy and Administration

description.narrative: Build training, information management, and planning capability in the audit department. Implement a focused program to systematically investigate and respond to employee corruption and misconduct. Support establishment of the Liberia Revenue Authority.

activity-date.narrative: Date unavailable. Calculated start date is the earliest transaction date
Date unavailable. Calculated end date is the latest transaction date

person-name.narrative: Andrew Velthaus, Jennifer Lee, and Kelley Vito

title.narrative: Technical Assistance for Banking & Financial Services - Liberia

description.narrative: The goal of this project is to assist the GoL in developing and maintaining a fair, safe, and stable financial sector that benefits and protects financial sector participants while maintaining public confidence in the financial system and supporting private sector-led economic growth. Project components will focus on: (1) strengthening the capacity of CBL banking and non-banking financial institution supervision to adequately regulate and supervise the banking and NBFI sectors; (2) establishing a deposit insurance regime that protects depositors in the event of bank failures and maintains public confidence in the financial sector; (3) developing and implementing an effective resolution framework that allows for the orderly resolution of failed financial institutions; (4) enhancing the CBL's capacity to monitor and react to macroprudential risks to financial sector stability; (5) strengthening the capacity of CBL insurance supervision staff to adequately regulate and supervise the insurance sector; and (6) enhancing financial sector compliance with International Financial Reporting Standards.

activity-date.narrative: Date unavailable. Calculated start date is the earliest transaction date

person-name.narrative: Andrew Velthaus, Jennifer Lee, and Kelley Vito

title.narrative: Technical Assistance for Economic Crimes -Liberia

description.narrative: Assist the Government of Liberia (GoL) to resolve impediments to effective implementation of its anti-money laundering and countering the financing of terrorism (AML/CFT) regime. Capacity building activities are focused, in particular, on improving the operation of the financial intelligence unit (FIU); financial sector supervision, with an initial emphasis on the banking sector; and financial crimes case development, including inter-agency collaboration on analysis, investigation, and prosecution of predicate crimes and associated money laundering. The interagency FCWG, which works with the ECT advisors as well as independently, plays a key role in identifying and working collaboratively to address impediments.
